A portable printer that uses recycled materials, has a compact design, and can print on various surfaces, such as fabric, paper, and even wood.
A smart printer that can detect and adapt to different paper types, adjust ink levels, and even learn the user's printing habits to optimize performance and reduce waste.
A 3D printer that uses biodegradable materials and can create functional objects, such as prosthetic limbs, tools, and household items, with a focus on sustainability and accessibility.
A printer that uses sound waves to create unique textures and patterns on various materials, allowing users to create artistic and functional designs.
A printer that can print directly onto clothing, accessories, and other fabrics, using a combination of heat, ink, and fabric-specific technology to create durable and long-lasting designs.
